chapter.title: Removing OpenAM Software
chapter.para: This chapter shows you how to uninstall OpenAM core software. See the Policy Agent Installation Guide for instructions on removing OpenAM agents.

procedure.title: To Remove OpenAM Core Software
procedure.para: After you have deployed and configured OpenAM core services, you have at least two, perhaps three or four, locations where OpenAM files are stored on your system.

You remove the internal OpenAM configuration store when you follow the procedure below. If you used an external configuration store, you can remove OpenAM configuration data after removing all the software.

step.para: Shut down the web application container in which you deployed OpenAM.
step.screen: $ /etc/init.d/tomcat stop Password: Using CATALINA_BASE: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_HOME: /path/to/tomcat Using CATALINA_TMPDIR: /path/to/tomcat/temp Using JRE_HOME: /path/to/jdk1.6/jre Using CLASSPATH: /path/to/tomcat/bin/bootstrap.jar: /path/to/tomcat/bin/tomcat-juli.jar

step.para: Unconfigure OpenAM by removing configuration files found in the $HOME directory of the user running the web application container.

For a full install of OpenAM core services, configuration files include the configuration directory, $HOME/openam, and the hidden file that points to the configuration directory such as $HOME/.openssocfg/AMConfig_path_to_tomcat_webapps_openam_.

note.para: At this point, you can restart the web container and configure OpenAM anew if you only want to start over with a clean configuration rather than removing OpenAM completely.

step.para: Remove the OpenAM web application by removing the .war file and expanded web application from the container.
If you have stored a download or unpacked version of OpenAM software on your system, you can now remove the files.
If you cannot find the original .zip, search for files named openam_*.zip.
If you cannot find the unpacked version, you might search for the directory named deployable-war.
